greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of length n words on alphabet {0,1,2} of the form 0^(i)1^(j)2^(k) such that i=j or j=k.
comment: The language of all such words is an example of a context-free language that can only be generated by ambiguous grammars.
reference: M. Sipser, An Introduction to the Theory of Computation, PWS Publishing Co., 1997, page 98.
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 27 2014
